thread.title: Tottenham's Harry Kane feels he is world-class after third hat-trick in 9 games breaks 100 career-goals milestone
thread.title_full: Tottenham's Harry Kane feels he is world-class after third hat-trick in 9 games breaks 100 career-goals milestone

author: Darren Lewis
title: Tottenham's Harry Kane feels he is world-class after third hat-trick in 9 games breaks 100 career-goals milestone
text:
In-form Kane has scored three times for two Sundays in a row (Photo: Reuters) Share     
Harry Kane finally sees himself as one of the best strikers in the world. 
The Tottenham star smashed his third hat-trick in nine matches in Sunday's win over Stoke — having also put three past both West Brom and Fulham recently — and reached 100 career goals in the process. 
Like Manchester United’s EFL Cup final match-winner Zlatan Ibrahimovic, fellow striker Kane is blowing his own trumpet midway through yet another outstanding season. 
The Premier League's Golden Boot holder said: “If you look at my stats, my goals, then I’m up there. 
"If you guys want to print that, I’m more than happy to have that. January 14: Kane clutches the match ball after putting three past West Brom (Photo: Reuters) February 19: Kane seems on the lookout for another match ball after netting all the goals in a 3-0 win at Fulham (Photo: Getty) February 26: Ref Jon Moss jokingly tries to deny the striker his prize for Saturday's treble vs Stoke (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
“I just try to do my best. 
"I like to score goals, obviously I will try to score as many as I can from now until the end of the season. I feel in good form.” 
Since the start of the 2014-15 campaign, Kane has scored more goals in all competitions than Barcelona ace Neymar and Atletico Madrid's sought-after Antoine Griezmann, and the same number as Sergio Aguero of Manchester City. Club goals since the start of the 2014-15 season 
Kane’s 17 goals so far this season put him joint-top of the Premier League scoring charts, with Everton's Romelu Lukaku and Alexis Sanchez of Arsenal — even though he missed seven weeks with an injury suffered in mid-September. 
The 23-year-old is now focused on retaining his domestic Golden Boot. Kane's 25 league goals last season won him the Barclays Golden Boot Award (Photo: Reuters) 
“That injury I had earlier in the season might have done me a bit of good, getting a bit more rest," said England international Kane, who was written off as a one-season wonder after his 31 goals in all competitions in his 2014-15 breakthrough campaign but netted 25 times in last season's top flight. 
He remains determined to shut his critics up. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
